avalancheActivity.comment:
Wind slabs can at their margins be released by large loads. Individual avalanche prone locations are to be found especially in extremely steep terrain at high altitude.
In steep terrain there is a danger of falling on the hard snow surface.
avalancheActivity.highlights: The snowpack will be quite stable.

snowpackStructure.comment: The older wind slabs have bonded quite well with the old snowpack. Sunshine and high temperatures gave rise to increasing consolidation of the snowpack. Snow depths vary greatly at intermediate and high altitudes, depending on the infuence of the wind. In particular at low and intermediate altitudes hardly any snow is lying.

avalancheActivity.comment: The snowpack will be stable. The older wind slabs are unlikely to be released now.
avalancheActivity.highlights: From a snow sport perspective, in most cases insufficient snow is lying.

snowpackStructure.comment: The surface of the snowpack will only just freeze. The snowpack will be subject to considerable local variations. Hardly any snow is lying above approximately 1800 m.
